name: google-key-management-service
label: Google Key Management Service
description: Google Key Management Service allows you to create, import, and manage cryptographic keys and perform cryptographic operations in a single centralized cloud service. This connector facilitates the automated operations related to location, keyRings, cryptoKey and cryptoKey version.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.name: server
fields.description: URL of the Google Key Management Service endpoint server to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.

fields.title: Client ID
fields.name: client_id
fields.description: Unique Client ID of the Google Key Management Service that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API.

fields.title: Client Secret
fields.name: client_secret
fields.description: Unique Client Secret of the Google Key Management Service that is used to create an authentication token required to access the API. For information, see Using OAuth 2.0 for Web Server Applications.

fields.title: Authorization Code
fields.name: code
fields.tooltip: The authorization code that you acquired during the authorization step. For more information, see Accessing the Google Key Management Service API.
fields.description: The authorization code that you acquired during the authorization step. For more information, see Accessing the Google Key Management Service API.

fields.title: Redirect URL
fields.description: The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. It must exactly match one of the redirect_uri's you registered in the app registration portal.
fields.name: redirect_url
fields.tooltip: The redirect_uri of your app, where authentication responses can be sent and received by your app. It must exactly match one of the redirect_uri's you registered in the app registration portal.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Get Locations List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of locations for a particular project from Google Key Management Service.

parameters.title: Project ID
parameters.description: ID of the project whose associated locations you want to retrieve from Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: project_id

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.description: (Optional) Filter based on which you want to retrieve locations from Google Key Management Service. For information on how to filter the locations, see 'https://google.aip.dev/160'.
parameters.name: filter
parameters.tooltip: Filter based on which you want to retrieve locations from Google Key Management Service. For information on how to filter the locations, see 'https://google.aip.dev/160'.

parameters.title: Page Token
parameters.description: (Optional) NextPageToken position returned by the last request. You can use this parameter to retrieve next page records.
parameters.name: pageToken

operations.title: Create KeyRing
operations.description: Creates a new KeyRing on your configured Google Key Management Service.

parameters.title: Project ID
parameters.description: ID of the project for which you want to create the KeyRing in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: project_id

parameters.title: Location ID
parameters.description: ID of the location for which you want to create the KeyRing in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: location_id

parameters.title: KeyRing ID
parameters.description: ID of the KeyRing based on which you want to create the KeyRing in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: key_ring_id
parameters.tooltip: Unique KeyRing ID within a location and match the regular expression [a-zA-Z0-9_-]{1,63}

operations.title: Get KeyRing List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of KeyRings from Google Key Management Service.

parameters.title: Project ID
parameters.description: ID of the project whose associated KeyRings you want to retrieve from Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: project_id

parameters.title: Location ID
parameters.description: ID of the location whose associated KeyRings you want to retrieve from Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: location_id

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.title: Page Token
parameters.description: (Optional) NextPageToken position returned by the last request. You can use this parameter to retrieve next page records.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.description: (Optional) Filter based on which you want to retrieve KeyRings from Google Key Management Service. For information on how to filter the KeyRings, see 'https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/sorting-and-filtering'.
parameters.name: filter
parameters.tooltip: Filter based on which you want to retrieve KeyRings from Google Key Management Service. For information on how to filter the KeyRings, see 'https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/sorting-and-filtering'.

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the field on which you want to sort the result. For information on how to order by the KeyRings, see 'https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/sorting-and-filtering#sort'.
parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Name of the field on which you want to sort the result. For information on how to order by the KeyRings, see 'https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/sorting-and-filtering#sort'.

operations.title: Get KeyRing Details
operations.description: Retrieves the information of the specified KeyRing from Google Key Management Service.

parameters.title: Project ID
parameters.description: ID of the project whose associated KeyRing you want to retrieve from Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: project_id

parameters.title: Location ID
parameters.description: ID of the location whose associated KeyRing you want to retrieve from Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: location_id

parameters.title: KeyRing ID
parameters.description: ID of the KeyRing whose information you want to retrieve from Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: key_ring_id

operations.title: Create CryptoKey
operations.description: Creates a new CryptoKey within an KeyRing in Google Key Management Service.

parameters.title: Project ID
parameters.description: ID of the project for which you want to create the CryptoKey in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: project_id

parameters.title: Location ID
parameters.description: ID of the location for which you want to create the CryptoKey in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: location_id

parameters.title: KeyRing ID
parameters.description: ID of the KeyRing based on which you want to create the CryptoKey in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: key_ring_id
parameters.tooltip: Unique KeyRing ID within a location and match the regular expression [a-zA-Z0-9_-]{1,63}

parameters.title: CryptoKey ID
parameters.description: ID of the CryptoKey based on which you want to create the CryptoKey in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: cryptoKeyId
parameters.tooltip: Unique cryptoKey ID within a key ring and match the regular expression [a-zA-Z0-9_-]{1,63}

parameters.title: Skip Initial Version Creation
parameters.description: (Optional) If set to true, the request will create a CryptoKey without any CryptoKeyVersions.
parameters.name: skipInitialVersionCreation
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) If set to true, the request will create a CryptoKey without any CryptoKeyVersions.

parameters.title: Purpose
parameters.description: (Optional) CryptoKeyPurpose describes the cryptographic capabilities of a CryptoKey. A given key can only be used for the operations allowed by its purpose. You can choose from the following options: Symmetric Encrypt/Decrypt, Asymmetric Sign, Asymmetric Decrypt, or MAC Signing/Verification.
parameters.name: purpose

parameters.title: Next Rotation Time
parameters.description: (Optional) DateTime when the next scheduled rotation is due to run. At nextRotationTime, the Key Management Service automatically creates a new version of this CryptoKey and marks the new version as primary. A timestamp or a date in RFC3339 UTC "Zulu" format, accurate to nanoseconds. For example, "2014-10-02T15:01:23.045123456Z".
parameters.name: nextRotationTime
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) DateTime when the next scheduled rotation is due to run. At nextRotationTime, the Key Management Service automatically creates a new version of this CryptoKey and marks the new version as primary. A timestamp or a date in RFC3339 UTC "Zulu" format, accurate to nanoseconds. For example, "2014-10-02T15:01:23.045123456Z".

parameters.title: Protection Level
parameters.description: (Optional) The Protection Level to use when creating a CryptoKeyVersion based on this template. You can choose from the following options: PROTECTION_LEVEL_UNSPECIFIED, SOFTWARE, HSM, or EXTERNAL.
parameters.name: protectionLevel
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) The Protection Level to use when creating a CryptoKeyVersion based on this template. You can choose from the following options: PROTECTION_LEVEL_UNSPECIFIED, SOFTWARE, HSM, or EXTERNAL.

parameters.title: Algorithm
parameters.description: (Optional) Algorithm to use when creating a CryptoKeyVersion based on this template. You can choose from the following options: CRYPTO_KEY_VERSION_ALGORITHM_UNSPECIFIED, GOOGLE_SYMMETRIC_ENCRYPTION, RSA_SIGN_PSS_2048_SHA256, etc.
parameters.name: algorithm
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Algorithm to use when creating a CryptoKeyVersion based on this template. You can choose from the following options: CRYPTO_KEY_VERSION_ALGORITHM_UNSPECIFIED, GOOGLE_SYMMETRIC_ENCRYPTION, RSA_SIGN_PSS_2048_SHA256, etc.

parameters.title: Labels
parameters.description: (Optional) Labels with user-defined metadata.
parameters.name: labels

parameters.title: Rotation Period
parameters.description: (Optional) Time between when new key versions are generated automatically. Must between 24 hours and 876,000 hours. If Rotation Period is set, Next Rotation Time must also be set. Keys with purpose ENCRYPT_DECRYPT support automatic rotation. For other keys, this field must be omitted. A duration in seconds.
parameters.name: rotationPeriod
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Time between when new key versions are generated automatically. Must between 24 hours and 876,000 hours. If Rotation Period is set, Next Rotation Time must also be set. Keys with purpose ENCRYPT_DECRYPT support automatic rotation. For other keys, this field must be omitted. A duration in seconds.

operations.title: Get CryptoKey List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of CryptoKeys from Google Key Management Service.

parameters.title: Project ID
parameters.description: ID of the project whose associated CryptoKeys you want to retrieve from Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: project_id

parameters.title: Location ID
parameters.description: ID of the location whose associated CryptoKeys you want to retrieve from Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: location_id

parameters.title: KeyRing ID
parameters.description: ID of the KeyRing whose associated CryptoKeys you want to retrieve from Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: key_ring_id

parameters.title: Page Size
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.title: Version
parameters.description: (Optional) Fields of the primary version to include in the response. You can choose from the following options: CRYPTO_KEY_VERSION_VIEW_UNSPECIFIED or FULL
parameters.name: versionView

parameters.title: Page Token
parameters.description: (Optional) NextPageToken position returned by the last request. You can use this parameter to retrieve next page records.
parameters.name: pageToken

parameters.title: Filter
parameters.description: (Optional) Filter based on which you want to retrieve CryptoKeys from Google Key Management Service. For information on how to filter the CryptoKeys, see 'https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/sorting-and-filtering'.
parameters.name: filter
parameters.tooltip: Filter based on which you want to retrieve CryptoKeys from Google Key Management Service. For information on how to filter the CryptoKeys, see 'https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/sorting-and-filtering'.

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the field on which you want to sort the result. For information on how to order by the CryptoKeys, see 'https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/sorting-and-filtering#sort'.
parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Name of the field on which you want to sort the result. For information on how to order by the CryptoKeys, see 'https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/sorting-and-filtering#sort'.

operations.title: Get CryptoKey Details

operations.title: Decrypt CryptoKey Details
operations.description: Decrypt the information for the CryptoKey that was protected by Encrypt in Google Key Management Service.

parameters.title: Project ID
parameters.description: ID of the project whose associated CryptoKey information you want to decrypt in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: project_id

parameters.title: Location ID
parameters.description: ID of the location whose associated CryptoKey information you want to decrypt in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: location_id

parameters.title: KeyRing ID
parameters.description: ID of the KeyRing whose information you want to decrypt in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: key_ring_id

parameters.title: CryptoKey ID
parameters.description: ID of the CryptoKey whose information you want to decrypt in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: cryptoKeyId

parameters.title: CipherText
parameters.description: The ciphertext to decrypt to base64 plain text
parameters.name: ciphertext

parameters.title: Additional Authenticated Data
parameters.description: (Optional) A base64-encoded string passed to Cloud KMS as part of an encrypt or decrypt request.
parameters.name: additionalAuthenticatedData

parameters.title: CipherText Crc32c
parameters.description: (Optional) The CipherText to decrypt to simple plain text
parameters.name: ciphertextCrc32c

parameters.title: Additional Authenticated Data Crc32c
parameters.description: (Optional) A string passed to Cloud KMS as part of an encrypt or decrypt request.
parameters.name: additionalAuthenticatedDataCrc32c

operations.title: Encrypt CryptoKey Details
operations.description: Encrypt the information for the specified CryptoKey in Google Key Management Service.

parameters.title: Project ID
parameters.description: ID of the project whose associated CryptoKey information you want to encrypt in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: project_id

parameters.title: Location ID
parameters.description: ID of the location whose associated CryptoKey information you want to encrypt in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: location_id

parameters.title: KeyRing ID
parameters.description: ID of the KeyRing whose information you want to encrypt in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: key_ring_id

parameters.title: CryptoKey ID
parameters.description: ID of the CryptoKey whose information you want to encrypt in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: cryptoKeyId

parameters.title: PlainText
parameters.description: The Base64 plain text to encrypt. Must be no larger than 64KiB.
parameters.name: plaintext

parameters.title: Additional Authenticated Data
parameters.description: (Optional) A base64-encoded string passed to Cloud KMS as part of an encrypt or decrypt request.
parameters.name: additionalAuthenticatedData

parameters.title: PlainText Crc32c
parameters.description: (Optional) A string passed to Cloud KMS as part of an encrypt or decrypt request.
parameters.name: plaintextCrc32c

parameters.title: Additional Authenticated Data Crc32c
parameters.description: (Optional) A string passed to Cloud KMS as part of an encrypt or decrypt request.
parameters.name: additionalAuthenticatedDataCrc32c

operations.title: Create CryptoKey Version
operations.description: Creates a new CryptoKey Version within an CryptoKey in Google Key Management Service.

parameters.title: Project ID
parameters.description: ID of the project for which you want to create the CryptoKey Version in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: project_id

parameters.title: Location ID
parameters.description: ID of the location for which you want to create the CryptoKey Version in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: location_id

parameters.title: KeyRing ID
parameters.description: ID of the KeyRing based on which you want to create the CryptoKey Version in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: key_ring_id
parameters.tooltip: Unique KeyRing ID within a location and match the regular expression [a-zA-Z0-9_-]{1,63}

parameters.title: CryptoKey ID
parameters.description: ID of the CryptoKey based on which you want to create the CryptoKey Version in Google Key Management Service.
parameters.name: cryptoKeyId
parameters.tooltip: Unique CryptoKey ID within a key ring and match the regular expression [a-zA-Z0-9_-]{1,63}

parameters.title: State
parameters.description: (Optional) The state of a CryptoKeyVersion, indicating if it can be used. You can choose from the following options: CRYPTO_KEY_VERSION_STATE_UNSPECIFIED, PENDING_GENERATION, ENABLED, DISABLED, DESTROYED, DESTROY_SCHEDULED, PENDING_IMPORT or IMPORT_FAILED.
parameters.name: state

parameters.title: External Key URI
parameters.description: (Optional) The URI for an external resource that this CryptoKeyVersion represents.
parameters.name: externalKeyUri

parameters.name: filter
parameters.tooltip: Filter based on which you want to retrieve CryptoKey Version from Google Key Management Service. For information on how to filter the CryptoKey Version, see 'https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/sorting-and-filtering'.

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the field on which you want to sort the result. For information on how to order by the CryptoKey Version, see 'https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/sorting-and-filtering#sort'.
parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Name of the field on which you want to sort the result. For information on how to order by the CryptoKey Version, see 'https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/sorting-and-filtering#sort'.
